summary: Initialize a Random Forest classification model
description: Defines a Random Forest classification model with parameters for tree count, split variables, and randomization seed.

parameters.name: num_trees
parameters.description: The number of trees to build within the Random Forest classification.

parameters.name: max_variables
parameters.description:
Specifies the number of variables considered for each split at a node.

Options include:

- *integer*: Specifies an exact number of variables per split.
- `all`: All variables are considered for each split.
- `log2`: Uses the base-2 logarithm of the variable count per split.
- `onethird`: Uses one-third of the total variables per split.
- `sqrt`: Uses the square root of the number of variables per split, often a default for classification.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: Optional random seed for sampling. If not provided or `null`, results may vary with each execution.

returns.description: A model definition that can be used in training or saved for later use.
